title: MLB draft winners and head-scratchers: What we loved -- and didn't -- on Day 1
content: The first 105 picks are in the books. With shocks at Nos. 1 and 2, here are the winners, losers and takeaways.

title: Nats surprise at top of MLB draft with SS Willits
content: The Nationals took high school shortstop Eli Willits with the No. 1 pick in the MLB draft, while Tyler Bremner went No. 2 to the Angels and LSU's Kade Anderson to the Mariners at No. 3.

title: Sheriff: Death of Elway's ex-agent an accident
content: The Riverside County sheriff told TV station 9NEWS that the investigation into Jeff Sperbeck's death after a fall from a golf cart found nothing criminal.

title: Chelsea wins CWC as Palmer double stuns PSG
content: Cole Palmer produced a scintillating first-half masterclass as Chelsea demolished Paris Saint-Germain 3-0 to win the Club World Cup final at New Jersey's MetLife Stadium on Sunday.

title: Sinner dethrones Alcaraz in rematch at Wimbledon
content: Jannik Sinner defeated two-time defending champion Carlos Alcaraz 4-6, 6-4, 6-4, 6-4 on Sunday to win his first Wimbledon championship and reverse the result of their epic French Open final five weeks ago.

title: NFLPA leaders back director Howell amid reports
content: The NFLPA's executive committee, in a message sent to membership, expressed its support for executive director Lloyd Howell Jr. as it looks into issues reported by ESPN last week.

title: Sources: Mavs shutting down Flagg for summer
content: The Mavericks are shutting down Cooper Flagg for the remainder of the NBA summer league, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: Clark, Fever ride record half past Bueckers, Wings
content: Caitlin Clark had 14 points and 13 assists as the Fever scored a franchise-record 64 points in the first half en route to a 102-83 victory against the Wings.

title: Pavelski wins Tahoe tournament; Barkley is 69th
content: Former NHL player Joe Pavelski won the American Century Championship on Sunday, closing with an eagle in a wire-to-wire victory in the celeb event.

title: 📷 Rockies' Holliday family throwback on draft day
content: The franchise celebrated selecting the son of former Rockies player Matt Holliday in the MLB draft by posting baby pics of Ethan in Rockies gear.

title: How Clark, Fever dropped 100 points on Paige Bueckers' Wings
content: Behind 13 assists from Caitlin Clark, the Fever put five players in double figures and scored 64 first-half points.

title: The Jannik Sinner-Carlos Alcaraz rivalry is one for the ages
content: On Sunday, Sinner defeated Alcaraz for the Wimbledon title -- the latest in a back-and-forth rivalry that will continue to entertain.

title: Club World Cup triumph shows Chelsea can win the Premier League
content: Chelsea have been crowned world champions -- but only when they end their Premier League title drought will the Blues be able to say they are back where they expect to be.

title: WNBA awards tracker: Collier has company in MVP conversation; Bueckers takes over ROY race
content: Paige Bueckers has emerged as the top rookie, while MVP favorite Napheesa Collier has some competition.

title: Who are the NFL's best offensive tackles? Execs, coaches and scouts help rank 2025's top 10
content: Who are the best offensive tackles in the NFL? We asked execs, coaches and scouts to rank their top 10 in our annual summer series.

title: Shane van Gisbergen takes Sonoma to extend win streak
content: Shane van Gisbergen extended his winning streak to two straight and three victories in the past five weeks with a dominating run at Sonoma Raceway.

title: Euro 2025 Daily: England thrash Wales and avoid Germany, Spain in bracket
content: England thrashed Wales and landed on the easier side of the bracket, as France topped Group D. Here's everything you need to know about Euro 2025 action.

title: PSG coach plays down Pedro push: Can't happen
content: Luis Enrique said he was trying to separate players during a post-match brawl at the end of Paris Saint-Germain's Club World Cup final defeat against Chelsea after footage appeared to show the him pushing Joao Pedro to the ground.

title: Golden Ball winner Palmer happy to silence critics
content: Cole Palmer spoke of taking satisfaction at proving doubters wrong after Chelsea's 3-0 win over Paris Saint-Germain in the Club World Cup final on Aunday.

title: Liverpool remember Jota in emotional first friendly
content: Liverpool and Preston North End players, staff and supporters paid tribute to Diogo Jota during their preseason friendly on Sunday.

title: Gyökeres warned with fines after going on strike
content: Sporting CP president Frederico Varandas has insisted that Viktor Gyökeres will face fines after he went on strike Saturday, refusing to report to the club's preseason training.

title: England take Wales for six, set up Sweden QF
content: Reigning European champions England thrashed neighbours Wales 6-1 to reach the Euro 2025 quarter-finals on Sunday, cruising into the knockouts on a high note.

title: Sources: FIFA omitted FIFPRO from welfare talks
content: FIFPRO was not invited to a summit meeting in New York between FIFA president Gianni Infantino and players' groups, sources have told ESPN.

title: Messi extends historic streak with 2 more goals
content: Lionel Messi extended his MLS-record streak of multigoal games as he scored twice in Inter Miami's win over Nashville.

title: Remembering Arthur Ashe's historic 1975 Wimbledon title
content: Stan Smith, Richard Evans and Chris Eubanks reflect on the 50th anniversary of Arthur Ashe's Wimbledon victory.

title: How Iga Swiatek defied all expectations to win her first Wimbledon title
content: After an early exit at her favorite Slam last month, Swiatek rebounded on her worst surface to take the Wimbledon title.

title: The unstoppable power of Jim Abbott's legacy
content: Abbott, who pitched in the majors with one hand, remains a beacon for families with unique struggles.

title: Why LeBron and the Lakers are stuck in limbo
content: For months, publicly and privately, the Lakers have been signaling their desire to begin the Luka Doncic era in Los Angeles, even if it meant ending the LeBron James one.

title: Talor Gooch takes second title in three years at LIV Andalucia
content: Talor Gooch parlayed a 4-shot lead going into the day at LIV Golf Andalucia into a 1-shot tournament championship.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Bayern turn to Trossard after Luis Diaz move stalls
content: Bayern Munich will turn to Arsenal forward Leandro Trossard if a move for Liverpool's Luis Díaz falls through. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Tillman to Leverkusen: Can USMNT star fill void left by Wirtz?
content: Malik Tillman is coming off a career year and Bayer Leverkusen are in transition. Is this a perfect match?

title: Security cordon around Bengal state secretariat as 'eligible teachers' plan protest march
content: Tight security at Nabanna as teachers demand job reinstatement, police deploy personnel and barricades to maintain order

title: Nimisha Priya case: The last-minute efforts to save Malayali nurse from execution in Yemen | Explained
content: Nimisha Priya, who is on death sentence at Central prison in Yemen’s capital Sanaa for alleged murder of a Yemeni national in 2017, is scheduled to be executed on July 16

title: B. Saroja Devi death: Karnataka leaders pay tributes to a timeless icon
content: Political leaders from Karnataka, including CM Siddaramaiah and DCM D.K. Shivakumar, remember Kannada cinema’s first female superstar

title: Supreme Court to hear on August 3 pleas seeking transparency in NEET-PG Exam evaluation process
content: Plea challenges NEET-PG evaluation system, seeks transparency in answer keys, revaluation, and fair assessment mechanisms

title: Kanwar yatra: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath asks officials to maintain heightened vigil
content: CM Yogi Adityanath instructed officials to ensure adequate arrangements along the yatra route, including cleanliness, medical services, drinking water, canteens, and toilets

title: Execution of Indian nurse in Yemen: Govt is keen to save its citizen, Attorney General tells SC
content: Attorney General of India R. Venkataramani said the government is working relentlessly to stay the execution of the nurse

title: Saroja Devi: The Kannadathu Payinkili and Abinaya Saraswathi of Tamil cinema
content: Having acted in 26 films with MGR, Saroja Devi is the second actor after Jayalalithaa (28 films) to have been paired with him.

title: Church mouthpiece slams BJP’s ‘double standards’ amid push to woo Christians in Kerala
content: Editorial in Deepika, official mouthpiece of Catholic Church in Kerala, highlights growing number of attacks against Christians across India

title: Protesters scuffle with police, roads blocked during BJP's 12-hour bandh in Bengal's Khejuri
content: BJP supporters blocked highways with tree trunks for several hours, before police removed the blockades and arrested eight people for causing disruption to traffic

title: Horticulture Department to launch guided walks in Lalbagh and Cubbon Park in Bengaluru
content: The walking tours will be called ‘Cubbon Walks’ and ‘Lalbagh Walks’, and will consist of a group of 20 people per walk

title: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari inaugurates Sigandur bridge in Karnataka
content: The bridge is the culmination of a long-time aspiration of people residing in villages of Karuru and Barangi hoblis in Sagar taluk who, in a celebration mood, decorated the structure with mango leaves

title: Kerala in Supreme Court pushes for withdrawal of ‘infructuous’ case against Governor
content: In this judgment, the top court had set a timeline of maximum three months for President, Governors to act on pending State Bills

title: Ilaiyaraaja vs Sony Music copyright dispute: SC to hear plea on July 18
content: The legal case started from a lawsuit initiated by Sony Music Entertainment India in 2022 before the Bombay High Court

title: Ahmedabad Air India plane crash: AAIB preliminary report did not find any mechanical or maintenance issues, says Air India CEO
content: Air India CEO acknowledged concerns raised by the report that have have also led to widespread speculations and said it has “provided both greater clarity and opened additional questions.”

title: Three injured as IED planted by Maoists explodes in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur
content: The incident took place on Sunday (July 13, 2025) evening when the three persons, residents of Dhangol village under Madded police station limits, had gone to a nearby forest to collect mushrooms, a police official said

title: I-T Department conducts raids in bogus tax deductions case
content: Certain individuals and their tax advisors like filers and accountants, who help claim bogus exemptions, are being searched as part of the operation

title: Secret recording of conversations of spouses can be used in matrimonial cases: Supreme Court
content: The apex court said the fact that spouses are recording their conversations of each other is proof in itself that their marriage is not going strong and hence can be used in the judicial proceedings

title: Madras High Court refuses to pass ex-parte interim order in Ilaiyaraaja’s suit over song use in Mrs. and Mr.
content: Justice Senthilkumar Ramamoorthy grants a week’s time for Vanitha Productions to file its counter affidavit to a dispute over the use of the song ‘Sivarathri’ in the movie ‘Mrs. and Mr.’

title: Supreme Court dismisses plea challenging tribunal’s order confirming ban extension on SIMI
content: A bench of Justices Vikram Nath and Sandeep Mehta dismissed the plea challenging the tribunal's July 24, 2024 order.

title: National Herald case: Court reserves order on taking cognisance of ED charge sheet
content: The chargesheet names Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi, Sam Pitroda, Suman Dubey, Sunil Bhandari, Young Indian and Dotex Merchandise Pvt Ltd

title: Parents of Tripura student, who died in Delhi, shifted for her higher education
content: Tragic death of Sneha Debnath in Delhi prompts investigation, leaving parents devastated and speechless, seeking answers

title: IIM-Calcutta rape accused bought sleeping pills to spike cold drinks offered to woman: Police
content: “The accused had admitted to having bought sleeping pills and spiked the cold drinks and drinking water which he had offered the woman when she was there,” a police officer said

title: Madras HC restrains temple activist Rangarajan Narasimhan from making defamatory remarks against Vedic scholar Dushyanth Sridhar
content: Justice K. Kumaresh Babu also restrains the temple activist from making any kind of statements against the counsel representing the opponents in his cases

title: Congress flags concerns as India-U.S. negotiate trade deal
content: “Warned against MASALA deals in trade negotiations with the U.S.,” says Jairam Ramesh, urging caution and avoiding hasty agreements

title: Madras High Court directs Puzhal Central Prison Superintendent to inform respective consulates about detention of foreigners
content: Justices M.S. Ramesh and V. Lakshminarayanan point out that it is mandatory to send such intimations under the Tamil Nadu Prison Rules

title: Sambhaji Brigade leader Pravin Gaikwad manhandled in Solapur for remarks against Swami Samarth
content: Pravin Gaikwad alleged that he was targeted over his "progressive thoughts" by followers of Hindutva ideology

title: Teenmar Mallanna’s office vandalised for his comments on Kavitha
content: BRS MLC Kavitha submits complaint with Legislative Council Chairman and DGP seeking action against the Congress MLC

title: Etihad asks pilots to exercise caution with fuel control switches on Boeing 787s, orders their inspection
content: The Etihad bulletin dated July 12 instructs pilots to “exercise caution when operating the fuel control switches or any other switches/control in their vicinity”

title: Government urged to complete Amaravati development in a time-bound plan
content: The Congress party would call for an all-party consultation and creation of a transparent, State-level monitoring committee to oversee Amaravati’s development

title: Major fire destroys furniture outlet in heart of Kochi city in Kerala
content: Fire broke out around 3 a.m. Eight Fire and Rescue Services units took over five hours to douse the fire and bring the situation under control. None hurt in the blaze

title: Lokesh, Jagan condole the death of farm workers in Railway Kodur road mishap
content: Terming the mishap “unfortunate” Mr. Lokesh directed the district administration to provide timely medical aid to the injured, assuring full government support to the bereaved families

title: CM Naidu expresses shock over Railway Kodur lorry accident
content: District Collector Sridhar Chamakuri briefed the Chief Minister on the tragic incident, informing that all the injured persons were under treatment

title: Jaishankar urges ‘continued normalisation’ of ties between India and China
content: Mr. Jaishankar also said the resumption of the Kailash Mansarovar Yatra is “widely appreciated in India”

title: Nine farm workers killed, 10 others injured after mango-laden lorry overturns near Andhra Pradesh’s Railway Kodur
content: At the time of the mishap, the lorry was carrying an overload of mangoes of about 40 tonnes, with twenty workers seated on the top of it

title: Who are qualified as ‘ordinarily resident’? | Explained
content: What does Section 20 of the Representation of the People Act, 1950 state? Why are migrant workers vulnerable when it comes to classifying themselves as ordinarily resident in a particular constituency? Are NRIs allowed to vote? What does the Registration of Electors Rules, 1960 govern?

title: Radhika Yadav’s murder was pre-mediated, planned for three days, claims her friend Himaanshika
content: Her friend also claims Radhika “felt suffocated at home” with many restrictions as her parents were “orthodox” and “influenced by the opinion of others”

title: Singapore is at ‘heart’ of India's Act East Policy: Jaishankar
content: Mr. Jaishankar, who was in Singapore as part of his two-nation trip, also met President Tharman Shanmugaratnam and Deputy Prime Minister Gan Kim Yong

title: Not foreigners, Biharis will decide fate of Bihar: BJP
content: The criticism came the same day officials said that field agents of the Election Commission have found "a large number of people" from Nepal, Bangladesh and Myanmar in their house-to-house visits

title: Mobile Internet services suspended in Haryana’s Nuh for 24 hours ahead of Brij Mandal Jalabhishek Yatra
content: To prevent any untoward incidents, the district administration has banned carrying of any weapons, including licensed weapons, firearms, swords, sticks, tridents, rods, knives and chains

title: Climate change is changing where and how Indians are living
content: Climate migration, which is the movement of people forced to leave their homes due to climate-related disasters, has led to widespread and often involuntary migration to urban areas and other regions, eroding social structures and worsening living and working conditions for migrants

title: Kashmir-based Islamic bodies upset by Shia cleric Imran Ansari remarks, calls for boycott
content: In a joint statement, the MMU, headed by Mirwaiz Umar Farooq, said it was deeply anguished and strongly condemned deliberate provocations by Mr. Ansari.

title: Push for long duration operation against militants in the higher reaches of Kupwara
content: In a rare visit, Director General of Police Nalin Prabhat took stock at the remote yet strategically sensitive region of Lolab close to the Line of Control

title: U.P. estimates 60 million devotees will take part in Kanwar Yatra
content: The state said it is implementing a women-centric security model by deploying over 10,000 women police personnel along the Yatra route.

title: Centre appoints Abhijat Sheth as new NMC chairperson
content: Dr. Sheth, a cardiothoracic surgeon, said that his priority would be to improve quality of medical education, promoting good governance, and foster teamwork to achieve governmental objectives.

title: Three Trinamool leaders killed in four days; intra-party feuds suspected
content: Piyush Ghosh, zonal president of the TMC in Sainthia, was killed in the early hours of Sunday; TMC leaders Razzak Khan and Abul Kalam Azad were killed on Thursday

title: A riot of colour, devotion and drumbeats: Bonalu draws lakhs to Ujjaini Mahankali temple
content: A major highlight of the day’s festivities was the spirited performance by the Potharajus, bare-chested men daubed in turmeric and vermillion, dancing to the beat of traditional drums

title: T.N. Chief Minister M.K. Stalin requests Jaishankar to secure release of fishermen from Sri Lankan custody
content: In the early hours of July 13, seven fishermen from Rameswaram were arrested by the Sri Lankan authorities

title: Former Asia Pacific Correspondent of The Hindu, P.S. Suryanarayana, passes away
content: He had worked as a foreign correspondent from Pakistan, Sri Lanka, Singapore and the U.S.; he also taught at universities in Singapore after retirement

title: Southern Railway launches drive to ensure safety at non-interlocked level crossing gates
content: Gatekeepers known for unsafe working behaviour, including sleeping and alcohol consumption, to be banned

title: No urgent safety concern in Air India crash report: FAA
content: The U.S. regulator makes no new recommendation of safety measures for Boeing 787-8; it reminds counterparts of 2018 advisory on potential disengagement of lock on fuel switches on the aircraft

title: Step up efforts to declare Thirukkural a national book, says CM Stalin
content: Since Aryanism can’t claim Thiruvalluvar as its own, there have  been attempts to appropriate him by portraying him in saffron. Cheating is the appropriate word to describe this appropriation, the Chief Minister says, releasing a commentary on The Thirukkural authored by lyricist Vairamuthu

title: Nipah death in Palakkad leads to alert in six Kerala districts
content: Apart from Palakkad, Malappuram, Kozhikode, Thrissur, Kannur and Wayanad districts have also been put on alert.

title: ‘U.S. donkey route’ case: ED probe reveals human traffickers used fake visas to send Indians abroad
content: During the searches so far, the ED says it has seized forged emigration stamps of various foreign countries, visa templates, various other related papers, and digital devices

title: Indian fertilizer majors sign deal with Saudi Arabia firm Ma’aden
content: The agreements will ensure supply of 3.1 million MT of DAP (Diammonium Phosphate) fertilizer per annum for five years from 2025-26 onwards

title: Indian astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla prepares to head back home
content: ‘Back from here, I carry with me a lot of memories, but one thing that really sticks to me is what humanity is capable of when all of us come together from different parts of the world and work for a common goal,’ the Indian astronaut said ahead of his return to Earth

title: Mamata Banerjee to lead protest in Kolkata on July 16 against targeting of migrants
content: Trinamool Congress to stage Statewide demonstrations amid reports of alleged harassment in BJP-ruled States

title: No ‘biryani’ in the tender document: BBMP clarifies on street dog menu
content: Of the estimated 2.7 lakh street dogs in Bengaluru, only around 4,000 of the most food-insecure are being targeted under this initiative

title: CCTV cameras to be fixed in 74,000 coaches: Railways
content: This will significantly improve safety of passengers, say officials; each coach will be equipped with four dome-type cameras placed at the entrance; cameras will be installed in 15,000 locomotives

title: Techie tries to sell sofa online, loses ₹ 9.6 lakh
content: The culprit allegedly convinced the complainant to transfer ₹12,000 multiple times claiming that the money will be credited to her account

title: A thunderous finale to the National Percussion Festival
content: The final day programmes began with a stunning performance of Pandi Melam by Peruvanam Kuttan Marar and ensemble

title: "95% Body Damaged": Father Of Odisha Student "Can't Recognise Daughter"
content: The father of the 22-year-old student who set herself on fire in front of her college in Odisha's Balasore district has said his daughter is in a critical condition and has suffered burns so severe that he is unable to recognise her.

title: Karnataka Man Stabs Friend To Death For Demanding Extra Chicken At Wedding Party
content: In a bizarre incident, a 30-year-old man was allegedly stabbed to death over a demand for an extra piece of chicken during a post-wedding dinner in Karnataka's Belagavi district.

title: Germany Has No Plans To Buy Additional F-35 Fighter Jets: Defence Ministry
content: Germany has no plans to procure additional F-35fighter jets, a defence ministry spokesperson said on Friday, denying a Politico report that the country planned to grow its planned fleet to 50.

title: "Baccha Aa Gaya": Ganja Seller Used A Code, Couple Actually Came With Child
content: An operation to bust a ganja distribution network in Hyderabad's IT corridor, Gachibowli, sprang a surprise when officials found that a couple had come to buy ganja with their 4-year-old child

title: Indian Woman Dies After UAE Home Catches Fire During "Special Ritual"
content: An Indian origin woman died after a fire broke out in her apartment in the United Arab Emirates' Sharjah.

title: 'Won't Be Stopped Today': Omar Abdullah Climbs Wall Amid Martyrs' Day Row
content: In a dramatic move, Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah drove to the Martyrs' Graveyard this morning, resisted police's attempts to stop him and other National Conference leaders from visiting the memorial, scaled a wall and paid tributes

title: "Rude Employees": Indian Grandmaster's "Worst Experience" With British Airways
content: The 21-year-old, Grandmaster Arjun Erigaisi currently seeded No. 1 for the upcoming FIDE Grand Swiss 2025, spoke out about an involuntary downgrade, unresponsive staff, and baggage delays.

title: India's Wholesale Inflation Turns 0.13% Negative In June After 2 Years
content: Wholesale inflation (WPI) in India turned negative in June at (-) 0.13 per cent as against 0.39 per cent in May, official data from the Ministry of Commerce and Industry showed on Monday.

title: How Cycling Can Be 4 Times More Efficient Than Walking, Experts Explains
content: You're standing at your front door, facing a five kilometre commute to work. But you don't have your car, and there's no bus route. You can walk for an hour - or jump on your bicycle and arrive in 15 minutes, barely breaking a sweat. Many people woul

title: Robert Vadra Reaches Probe Agency Office, Wife Priyanka Gandhi By His Side
content: Businessman Robert Vadra, husband of Congress MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra and brother-in-law of Leader of Opposition Rahul Gandhi, has appeared before the Enforcement Directorate for questioning in a money laundering probe linked to a London property.

title: Air India Crash Initial Report Found No Mechanical Or Maintenance Issues: CEO
content: A month after India witnessed one of its worst air crashes in decades, Air India CEOCampbell Wilson pointed out that the preliminary report on the AI171 crash found no mechanical or maintenance issue with the doomed aircraft or its engines.

title: Amid Air India Probe, Etihad To Check Fuel Switch Locks On Boeing 787 Planes
content: Etihad Airways has advised its pilots operating Boeing 787 Dreamliners to "exercise caution" when handling the aircraft's fuel control switches.

title: Karnataka: Car Plunges Into Canal Near Shiradi Ghat Amid Heavy Rains
content: The Malnad region has been witnessing heavy rainfall over the past several days, causing streams, rivulets, and roadside waterfalls to overflow.

title: China's "Dragon-Elephant Tango" Call After S Jaishankar Meets Vice President
content: Expressing readiness to work with New Delhi to achieve "dragon-elephant tango"-- a dance between their emblematic animals-- Beijing on Monday said both China and India are major developing economies and important members of the Global South.

title: Scientists Detect Biggest Merger Of Two Black Holes In History
content: Scientists have detected the most massive merger of two black holes ever recorded for the first time in history.

title: 3 Delhi Schools Receive Bomb Threats, Prompting Emergency Services
content: At least three schools in the national capital received bomb threats on Monday morning, prompting the emergency services to be kicked in, a Delhi Police official said.

title: 2 Dead, 1 Missing As Car Gets Swept Away In Flooded Causeway In Gujarat
content: A child and an elderly man drowned and another person was missing after their car was swept away in an overflowing causeway near Godhawata village in Gujarat's Botad district, officials said Monday.

title: Omar Abdullah Calls Newspapers "Cowards" For Not Reporting House Arrest
content: Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah on Monday expressed anguish over the missing media coverage in local newspapers on the issue of "the entire elected government being locked up".

title: Delhi University Student Found Dead In Yamuna Was 'Overachiever': Family
content: Sneha Debnath, the 19-year-old Delhi University student whose body was recovered from the Yamuna last evening, was an overachiever pursuing two courses simultaneously and also working as an intern

title: Deleted Data, New Instagram Profile: Radhika Yadav's Phone Now In Focus
content: The investigation into the killing of 25-year-old state-level tennis player Radhika Yadav has turned towards the contents of her mobile phone, with the police now attempting to retrieve deleted data that could provide insight into the circumstances l

title: 'No mechanical issues': Air India CEO reacts to AAIB crash probe report
content: Air India's CEO Campbell Wilson addressed employees following the preliminary report on the AI 171 crash, which claimed 270 lives. The report found no mechanical issues with the Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner or its engines, and all mandatory maintenance was completed. Air India is now focused on regaining traveler confidence and ensuring safety, while also supporting the bereaved and injured.

title: Martyrs' Day row in J&K: CM Omar Abdullah scales boundary wall to offer prayers - watch
content: Omar Abdullah, former Jammu and Kashmir chief minister, resorted to scaling a graveyard wall in Srinagar to offer prayers on Martyrs' Day after alleging repeated obstruction by security forces. He criticized the government for attempting to suppress the remembrance of the 1931 martyrs and accused local media of downplaying the house arrests of elected leaders.

title: Karnataka bridge launch row: CM Siddaramaiah writes to Gadkari; seeks postponement of event
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah has requested Union Minister Nitin Gadkari to postpone the Shivamogga National Highway inauguration, citing a lack of prior consultation and a scheduling conflict with another event in Vijayapura district. Siddaramaiah emphasized the importance of coordinating such state-level programs with the state government.

title: '60 CCTV cameras, not one was functional': 19-yr-old DU student found dead; missing since July 7
content: The body of Sneha Debnath, a 19-year-old Delhi University student, was recovered from the Yamuna River on Sunday, nearly a week after she reportedly jumped from Signature Bridge. Debnath had sent messages to friends indicating her intent. Her family, including her retired Army officer father, had appealed for help.

title: Govt breaks silence on Chinese engineers leaving iPhone maker Foxconn’s plant
content: The Indian government is closely watching the departure of Chinese engineers from Foxconn, a major iPhone supplier, but believes Apple has solutions to maintain production. Despite concerns about potential disruptions to iPhone 17 production, Apple is increasing iPhone production in India, aiming for 60 million units this year, with eased component sourcing from China and government support through visa facilitation.

title: 'Baccha aagaya': 14 held in Hyd IT hub for buying drugs; most in 22-34 age group
content: In Gachibowli, Hyderabad, a decoy operation led to the apprehension of 14 individuals seeking to purchase ganja from a peddler near a bank. Among those caught were students, IT professionals, and two couples, one with a young child. The peddler, identified as Sandeep from Maharashtra, managed to escape, while the anti-narcotics wing EAGLE orchestrated the bust.

title: What did P Kashyap, Saina's ex-husband, post hours before their split? See story
content: Just hours before Saina Nehwal's announcement of their separation, Parupalli Kashyap shared an Instagram post from the Awakenings Festival in the Netherlands. Saina Nehwal, the Olympic bronze medalist, revealed the decision to end their nearly seven-year marriage, citing the need for peace, growth, and healing. The couple, who married in 2018, have requested privacy during this time.

title: What US FAA and Boeing's 'privately issued notifications' say amid AI 171 crash probe
content: Following the Air India Boeing 787-8 crash that killed 260, the FAA and Boeing have privately assured the safety of fuel switch locks on Boeing aircraft. A preliminary investigation revealed the fuel switches flipped to 'cutoff' after takeoff. Pilots' association rejected suggestions of pilot error, emphasizing potential equipment malfunction and calling for a fair inquiry.

title: Saina Nehwal pens heartfelt note confirming the end of her marriage with Parupalli Kashyap
content: Badminton stars Saina Nehwal and Parupalli Kashyap have announced their separation. The couple married in 2018. They met at Pullela Gopichand Academy. Saina shared a message on Instagram. She mentioned choosing peace and growth. Both athletes have achieved significant milestones in their careers. They request privacy during this time. Fans are wishing them well for the future.

title: F-1 visa hold leaves Indian student in limbo; passport stuck; here's what happened
content: An Indian student’s US F-1 visa was delayed and her passport retained after a consular officer flagged her Reddit account for not being listed on her DS-160. Although the account was public and clean, it was misread as private. The case highlights growing digital scrutiny in student visas and the risks of automated vetting errors.

title: Schools in Nuh district of Haryana closed today: Here's why
content: All schools in Haryana’s Nuh district were shut on Monday as authorities enforced strict security measures ahead of the Braj Mandal Jalabhishek Yatra. The move, aimed at averting communal unrest, has disrupted exams and severed access to online learning amid a parallel internet shutdown. With academic activity halted, students have once again become collateral in a district on high alert.

title: Head of infrastructure engineering at Elon Musk’s AI company resigns
content: Uday Ruddarraju, xAI's head of infrastructure engineering, has resigned after a year, having been instrumental in building the Colossus supercomputer and training Grok 3. He expressed gratitude to Elon Musk and the xAI team for the experience. Shortly after his departure, Ruddarraju announced he is joining OpenAI, with OpenAI President Greg Brockman welcoming him and other engineers.

title: San Rechal, Puducherry model known for challenging skin bias, dies by suicide
content: San Rechal Gandhi, a prominent model from Puducherry celebrated for winning regional beauty pageants including Miss Puducherry 2020, has tragically died by suicide. Police investigations suggest that Rechal was facing immense financial difficulties and struggling with significant debt. She had previously spoken about the discrimination she experienced due to her skin tone.

title: BJP alleges Siddaramaiah, DKS trying to mobilise MLAs' support; claims 'horses ready'
content: A political clash erupts between the Congress and BJP. Congress MLA Vijayanand Kashappanavar alleges the BJP is intimidating Congress legislators. He claims the BJP threatens them with ED and CBI raids. This is to force them to join the saffron party. The BJP refutes these allegations. Union Minister Pralhad Joshi accuses Congress leaders Siddaramaiah and Shivakumar of internal horse-trading.

title: ‘Shubman Gill must decide — be like Dhoni or Kohli,’ says Manjrekar
content: Sanjay Manjrekar suggests England's aggressive tactics unsettled Shubman Gill during his brief innings at Lord's, leading to his dismissal for 6. Manjrekar draws comparisons between Gill, Virat Kohli, and MS Dhoni, advising Gill to identify whether calmness or anger brings out his best performance.

title: 'Friendship is done': Swift unlikely to forgive Blake Lively after betrayal
content: Taylor Swift and Blake Lively's friendship faces trouble. Sources say they are not in contact. This follows Lively's connection to Justin Baldoni's legal issues. Lively's image suffered, straining the bond. Swift is now focused on Travis Kelce. Lively seeks new high-profile connections. The friendship may be over. Both are moving on with their careers and relationships.

title: Connor McDavid torn: Stay loyal to Oilers or test free agency?
content: Elliotte Friedman suggests Connor McDavid is likely to sign a contract extension with the Edmonton Oilers, securing his future with the team beyond the 2025-26 season. Despite recent playoff heartbreaks and speculation about McDavid exploring free agency, the Oilers' captain seems committed to chasing a Stanley Cup in Edmonton. Negotiations for a lucrative contract extension are expected.

title: “It’s in my DNA”: Ciara embraces New York spotlight as Russell Wilson begins fresh start with Giants
content: Ciara and Russell Wilson are making waves as they transition to New York City, with Wilson joining the Giants. Ciara expressed excitement about embracing the city's culture and educational opportunities for their children, highlighting her family's deep roots in New York. The move marks a significant new chapter for the couple, with Wilson's NFL comeback and Ciara's ventures.

title: India-US trade deal: Opening dairy sector to America could cause huge losses
content: India-US trade deal: India is hesitant to open its dairy and agriculture sectors to the US as part of the trade deal, fearing significant losses for its dairy farmers. An SBI analysis suggests potential annual losses of Rs 1.03 lakh crore if the sector is opened to US imports.

title: NASA confirms 3I/ATLAS as third interstellar object passing through our solar system
content: NASA confirms the arrival of 3I/ATLAS, the third interstellar object. The ATLAS project spotted it in June 2025. Its speed and trajectory confirm it's not bound by the Sun. Scientists are eager to study this rare visitor from another star system. It will pass near Mars in October 2025.

title: Sotheby’s to auction largest Mars rock ever found on Earth in New York; here’s how it came to our planet
content: A rare Martian meteorite and a dinosaur skeleton will headline Sotheby’s Geek Week 2025 auction in New York. The Martian meteorite, NWA 16788, weighs 54 pounds. It is the largest Martian rock ever found on Earth. A Ceratosaurus skeleton, over 6 feet tall, will also be auctioned. The event will feature 122 items, including rare meteorites and fossils.

title: National Herald: Delhi court reserves order on ED case against Sonia, Rahul Gandhi
content: A Delhi court has reserved its order until July 29 on whether to acknowledge the Enforcement Directorate's (ED) case against Sonia Gandhi, Rahul Gandhi, and others in the National Herald money laundering case.

title: Wimbledon: Neeraj reveals tennis player that inspires him; Preity Zinta also in attendance
content: Jannik Sinner triumphed over Carlos Alcaraz in the Wimbledon 2025 final, avenging his French Open loss. The Centre Court match drew a star-studded audience, including India's Neeraj Chopra, attending his first tennis tournament, and Preity Zinta, Punjab Kings co-owner, who expressed her excitement to relax and enjoy the event.

title: Air India crash: US FAA, Boeing says 'fuel switch locks safe'; probe report raised questions
content: Following the Air India Flight 171 crash, the FAA and Boeing have privately affirmed the safety of fuel switch locks on Boeing aircraft. India's AAIB preliminary report questioned if the fuel switches were accidentally activated, leading to engine failure. The FAA issued a notification stating the fuel control switch design doesn't warrant an Airworthiness Directive.

title: Smiling, posing in flight suits: Shubhanshu poses with crew at space station; see pics
content: Astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla, the first Indian on the ISS, concluded his 18-day mission with a group photo, celebrating international collaboration. Preparing to return via the Dragon spacecraft, Shukla expressed gratitude to the Expedition 73 crew. He evoked Rakesh Sharma's legacy, highlighting India's ambitious and confident presence in space. This ISRO-funded journey is crucial for India's Gaganyaan mission, planned for 2027.

title: FASTag users alert! You may risk blacklisting over this common mistake
content: The National Highways Authority of India is cracking down on FASTag misuse. Specifically, the focus is on 'loose FASTags'. Toll agencies must report instances of improper FASTag placement. NHAI will blacklist offenders. This action supports upcoming tolling advancements. These include the FASTag-based Annual Pass System. Multi-Lane Free Flow tolling is also coming. A FASTag annual pass will soon be available.

title: Samosa, jalebi join cigarettes on health alert list
content: The health ministry is mandating "oil and sugar boards" in central institutions like AIIMS Nagpur to highlight hidden fats and sugars in common snacks. This initiative aims to combat the rising obesity crisis in India, where a significant portion of the population is projected to be overweight by 2050.

title: Trump's Ukraine U-turn: US to announce aggressive weapons plan for Kyiv; what it means
content: President Trump is poised to unveil a more aggressive plan to arm Ukraine, signaling a shift in his administration's approach to the conflict with Russia. The package is expected to include offensive weapons, long-range missiles, and Patriot air defense systems. This decision follows Trump's growing frustration with Putin and a renewed commitment to supporting Ukraine's defense, with the U.S.

title: UKHSA: How antidepressants and other drugs can raise your risk in hot weather
content: UK Health Agency warns that certain medications increase heat risks. These drugs affect body's cooling mechanisms. Medicines like diuretics and mental health drugs are highlighted. Heat can degrade medication potency. Proper storage and hydration are crucial. Elderly and those with chronic conditions are most vulnerable. Health professionals should offer guidance. Simple precautions can prevent heat-related issues.

title: 'If Telugu is like mother, Hindi is aunt': Pawan Kalyan backs Hindi; calls it language of unity
content: Andhra Pradesh Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan advocated for Hindi as a unifying language that offers opportunities, comparing it to a familial relationship. He encouraged embracing Hindi, noting its widespread understanding and his personal use of it. The event also featured speakers highlighting Hindi's promotion and growing acceptance across different regions, including Tamil Nadu.

title: Indonesia: 6.5 magnitude earthquake hits Tanimbar Islands
content: A significant 6.5 magnitude earthquake rattled the Tanimbar Islands region of Indonesia, originating at a depth of 110 kilometers. While there were no immediate reports of damage or casualties, the event underscores Indonesia's vulnerability to seismic activity due to its location on the Pacific Ring of Fire.

title: Gold price prediction: What's the rate outlook for July 14 - should you buy or sell?
content: Gold price prediction today: Amid escalating trade tensions fueled by President Trump's tariff policies, gold prices are expected to remain range-bound between Rs 96,000 and Rs 99,000. Last week saw silver hitting domestic highs and gold reaching a three-week peak due to safe-haven demand.

title: 'Stumps flying is why we play' — Sundar after dream spell at Lord’s | Watch
content: Washington Sundar's remarkable performance at Lord's led India to a memorable victory. The off-spinner's four wickets, all bowled, triggered an England collapse. A BCCI video captured the team's excitement, with Sundar expressing his joy at seeing the stumps fly. Teammates like Prasidh Krishna and Sai Sudharsan lauded Sundar's control and impact, highlighting the magical day of Test cricket.

title: 'Talks beautifully, then bombs people': Trump calls out Putin; sanctions on Russia in works?
content: US President Donald Trump has criticized Vladimir Putin's attacks on Ukraine, following a major Russian airstrike. Trump indicated potential sanctions and confirmed the US will send Patriot air defense systems to Kyiv. He mentioned a deal where Nato would reimburse the US for the weapons. A major announcement is expected soon, signaling a possible shift in US policy towards Russia.

title: Delhi bomb scare: 3 schools receive threat mails; police launch search ops
content: On Monday morning, bomb threat emails targeted at least three schools in Delhi, including Navy School in Chanakyapuri and CRPF Schools in Dwarka and Rohini, triggering extensive search operations. Police and bomb disposal squads were immediately dispatched to the schools after the threats were reported around 8 am.

title: 'Life takes us....': Saina Nehal announces separation from husband P Kashyap
content: Badminton stars Saina Nehwal and Parupalli Kashyap have announced their separation after six years of marriage. Nehwal, an Olympic bronze medalist, shared the news on Instagram, citing a mutual decision for peace and growth. The couple, who trained together at the Pullela Gopichand Academy, married in 2018. Nehwal has been battling arthritis, impacting her training.

title: Colon cancer rising among youngsters: Top US doc alerts about 5 warning signs
content: Alarmingly, colon cancer is increasingly affecting younger adults, with millennials facing double the risk compared to those born in 1950. Gastroenterologist Dr. Joseph Salhab highlights rectal bleeding, unexplained abdominal pain, persistent fatigue, and changes in bowel habits as critical warning signs. Early detection is crucial for successful treatment.

title: 'Uneducated': BJP slams Tejashwi's 'sootra' remark on SIR; demands apology
content: A political firestorm erupts in Bihar over alleged illegal foreign nationals on voter lists, as BJP's Sanjay Jaiswal slams RJD's Tejashwi Yadav for dismissing the reports. Jaiswal demands an apology, calling Yadav uneducated and irresponsible. Tejashwi questions the timing and intent of the Election Commission's revision, claiming it's politically motivated and an eyewash.

title: Actor Saroja Devi passes away at 87
content: B. Saroja Devi, the celebrated actress known as "Abhinaya Saraswathi," has passed away at 87. A prominent figure in South Indian cinema, she starred in over 200 films across multiple languages, gaining fame with 'Nadodi Mannan.' Her contributions were recognized with Padma Shri and Padma Bhushan awards, solidifying her legacy in Indian cinema.

title: Shubhanshu set to return from space; what's next for him; how he’ll cope with Earth’s gravity
content: Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla, India's first astronaut to the ISS, is returning to Earth on Tuesday after an 18-day mission. The Dragon spacecraft is set to undock on Monday, with splashdown expected off California. Shukla, along with three other astronauts, conducted over 60 experiments during their stay.

title: First visit since Galwan clash: EAM Jaishankar meets China's Vice President Han Zheng
content: External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar met Chinese Vice President Han Zheng in Beijing, expressing optimism about improved bilateral ties following a meeting between PM Modi and President Xi Jinping. He conveyed India's support for China's SCO presidency and highlighted the resumption of the Kailash Mansarovar Yatra.

title: UP encounter: Mukhtar Ansari gang shooter gunned down
content: In a significant crackdown, the Meerut Special Task Force (STF) neutralized Shahrukh Pathan, a notorious shooter associated with the Mukhtar Ansari gang and linked to slain gangster Sanjeev Maheshwari Jeeva. The encounter occurred after Pathan allegedly opened fire on the police, discharging over 10 rounds.

title: Shubhanshu Shukla to return Earth after historic ISS mission; know what he achieved through space experiments
content: Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla is returning to Earth on July 15 after 18 days on the ISS, marking India's return to human spaceflight after 41 years. As part of Axiom Mission 4, he conducted over 60 experiments, including ISRO-designed projects for the Gaganyaan mission. Shukla honored ISRO and India's space legacy during his farewell, inspiring future generations.

title: Chelsea wins Club World Cup: Why fans are accusing Trump of doing a 'John Terry'
content: In a bizarre turn of events, Donald Trump joined Chelsea FC's Club World Cup celebration in 2025, drawing comparisons to John Terry's infamous Champions League appearance. Trump's presence at the match, framed as a test run for the 2026 World Cup, sparked mixed reactions and highlighted the growing intersection of sports and politics.

title: Bitcoin touches $120,000 for the first time; investors eye key US crypto bills - check details
content: Bitcoin soared to a record high of over $120,000 on Monday, fueled by growing optimism surrounding potential regulatory clarity in the US. The surge contributed to a broader rally in digital currencies, with Ether reaching a five-month peak.

title: Christian McCaffrey and Olivia Culpo announce birth of first child with joint post
content: Christian McCaffrey  and Olivia Culpo welcomed their first child. The  San Francisco 49ers  star running back and former Miss Universe announced the news in a joint Instagram post on Sunday. The black-and-white photo collage included images of the couple in the delivery room as well each of them cradling their baby. McCaffrey and Culpo  announced in March  that they were expecting. A post shared by Olivia Frances Culpo (@oliviaculpo) "Colette Annalise McCaffrey" the couple wrote together on Instagram. Culpo posted a photo of McCaffrey with their baby on her Instagram story, captioning it: "Colette is so lucky to have the best daddy in the world. A love like no other." She also added a photo of McCaffrey consoling Culpo while in the delivery room, writing: "The scariest and most rewarding of all experiences. As soon as he came into the room I felt most at peace." McCaffrey and Culpo  married in June 2024 .

title: Klay Thompson fuels relationship rumors with Megan Thee Stallion
content: Klay Thompson's trip to the Bahamas led to the usual offseason vacation social media collage . rumors about the rapper's relationship started swirling after the rapper posted a photo on Instagram . in one slide, the rapper posed alongside someone, presumed to be Pete, facing away from the camera .

title: Nats take Eli Willits No. 1! 2025 MLB draft tracker live picks and analysis
content: day 1 of the 2025 MLB draft is in the books, with the Washington Nationals taking prep shortstop Eli Willits with the no. 1 overall pick . the los Angeles Angels followed up by college pitcher Tyler Bremner and the Seattle Mariners nabbed another in Kade Anderson at third .
